Package utils

Class CollisionChecker

java.lang.Object
utils.CollisionChecker
public class CollisionChecker extends Object
A class implementing methods to check rather a player/vehicle is colliding with a boundary, such as a river, building, river or window boundaries.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Tom Zehle

  • Constructor Details

    • CollisionChecker

      public CollisionChecker()

  • Method Details

    • collisioncheckX

      public double collisioncheckX​(double x, double y, double d_x)
      A function to check rather the player/vehicle is hitting a boundary with a specific move in x-direction. If so, stop the move.
      Parameters:
      double - x - the x-coordinate of player/vehicle
      double - y - the y-coordinate of player/vehicle
      double - d_x - the x-direction the player wants to move in.

    • collisioncheckY

      public double collisioncheckY​(double x, double y, double d_y)
      A function to check rather the player/vehicle is hitting a boundary with a specific move in y-direction. If so, stop the move.
      Parameters:
      double - x - the x-coordinate of player/vehicle
      double - y - the y-coordinate of player/vehicle
      double - d_y - the y-direction the player wants to move in.

    • addboundary

      public void addboundary​(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Add boundaries to the instance variable of type arraylist named boundaries.
      Parameters:
      x1 - : the left edge of the boundary
      y1 - : the upper edge of the boundary
      x2 - : the right edge of the boundary
      y2 - : the lower edge of the boundary
